intro: Anoiganthus luteus, commonly known as the yellow monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Anoiganthus luteus plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native environment.
